meanings.definition: The process of treating rubber or rubber-like materials with sulfur and heat to improve elasticity and strength.
meanings.sent1: The vulcanizations of the rubber made it more flexible and durable.
meanings.sent2: The factory used vulcanizations to enhance the properties of the rubber tires.
meanings.sent3: After the accidental vulcanizations of the eraser, it bounced off the table!
meanings.sent4: His determination was like the vulcanizations of rubber, making him resilient to challenges.
meanings.sent5: The vulcanizations of the material were so effective that it felt like a new substance altogether.

meanings.definition: The act of making something hard or strong through a chemical process involving sulfur and heat.
meanings.sent1: The vulcanizations of the metal turned it into a sturdy tool.
meanings.sent2: The vulcanizations of the plastic increased its durability significantly.
meanings.sent3: The accidental vulcanizations of the ice cube made it unbreakable!
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was like the vulcanizations of steel, unyielding to pressure.
meanings.sent5: The vulcanizations of the clay transformed it into a solid sculpture.
